text: Update: seems that setting the <img> tag's width attribute as: `width="600"` got it to render properly in Outlook, even though `width="100%"` should have been fine...

since later versions of outlook renders through MS Word, it has to have absolute values, not relative ones.  This can become problematic if you're trying to make your email responsive for other clients as well, so I'd suggest looking into how to make hybrid templates that use MSO fallbacks

How do people handle CTA coding in email? I'd use bulletproof buttons but there doesn't seem to be a good way of doing these for HubSpot CTAs.

Does anyone have examples of what they do?
